thread.title: Auburn basketball picked to finish in bottom half of SEC
thread.title_full: Auburn basketball picked to finish in bottom half of SEC

author: Brandon Marcello | bmarcello@al.com
title: Auburn basketball picked to finish in bottom half of SEC
text:
Comments 
Expectations, believe it or not, are lower in Bruce Pearl's second season at Auburn, according to a vote by the media. 
The Tigers were selected to finish 10th in the SEC in the upcoming season a year after they were voted eighth before Pearl's first season on the Plains. 
Auburn must replace its top two scorers, including the SEC's scoring champion (KT Harrell), but brings in a top-20 recruiting class that includes seven newcomers Pearl has described as faster and more athletic than his previous group on the Plains. 
Auburn conducts its fan day Thursday starting at 7 p.m. inside Auburn Arena. "Pearl Jam" will include a dunk and 3-point contest. 
The Tigers' first exhibition game is Oct. 30 against Brevard College. They open the season at home against UAB, an NCAA Tournament team last season, on Nov. 13. Auburn's Bruce Pearl talks leadership, newcomers and more Auburn men's basketball coach Bruce Pearl speaks with the media after practice on Oct. 20, 2015. (Wesley Sinor/wsinor@al.com)
